    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Start network control by starting both receptions threads (Multicast and UDP ones).
        Overrides:
        start in class java.lang.Thread
        See Also:
        ThreadReceiverUDP, ThreadReceiverMulticast

      • run

        public void run()
        Thread run method to control the state of the connection and the Queue linked to every message reception. When a message is received, reception thread will put it into the Queue and this method will get it and treat it to make some action in function of this message.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • isPseudoOK

        public boolean isPseudoOK()
        Check is the state is PSEUDOOK. Return True if the state is PSEUDOOK, False otherwise.
        Returns:
        boolean True if the state is PSEUDOOK, False otherwise.

      • networkConnected

        public void networkConnected()
        Set the current state on CONNECTED

      • login

        public void login​(java.lang.String pseudo)
        Method to login yourself on the network with the given pseudo via the messageSender. Other users will be able to see you after this method.
        Parameters:
        pseudo - Your pseudo
        See Also:
        MessageSender

      • testUserConnected

        public void testUserConnected()
        Method to test who is connected on the network via the messageSender. Other users should respond to this request.
        See Also:
        MessageSender

      • sendMessageUDP

        public void sendMessageUDP​(java.lang.String message_to_send,
                           java.net.InetAddress target_address)
        Method to send an UDP message to a given address using MessageSender and write this sent message to the history file linked to the address you sent the message to.
        Parameters:
        message_to_send - The message you want to send
        target_address - IP Address of the user you want to send the message to
        See Also:
        MessageSender

        Parameters:
        message_to_send - The message you want to send
        See Also:
        MessageSender

      • sendMessageTCP

        public void sendMessageTCP​(java.net.Socket socket,
                           java.lang.String message_to_send,
                           java.net.InetAddress target_address)
        This method is currently not used in the application, which is UDP based. Method to send an TCP message to a given address using MessageSender and write this sent message to the history file linked to the address you sent the message to.
        Parameters:
        message_to_send - The message you want to send
        target_address - IP Address of the user you want to send the message to
        See Also:
        MessageSender

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Method to disconnect yourself on the network via the messageSender. Other users will be aware of your disconnection.
        See Also:
        MessageSender

        public boolean isConnected()
        Return true if the network state is CONNECTED.

      • writeFileSend

        public void writeFileSend​(java.lang.String message_sended,
                          java.net.InetAddress inetAdr_target)
        This method is used when a message is sent to another user. It write the sent message on a file named with the destination address (where '.' are replaced by '_'). This file will be used as history for the conversation with the receiver.
        Parameters:
        message_received - The message you sent and you will write into the file.
        inetAdr_sources - The destination address of the message you sent.
